website_summaries.verdict: The Brooks Cascadia 11 is a versatile trail running shoe that offers a balance of cushioning, support and protection. With the impressive traction, this shoe will not disappoint trail runners who love to run in rough terrains. Overall, the Cascadia 11 is an average trail running companion.
pros: Runners applauded the rugged outsole of the Brooks Cascadia 11 that delivers great traction for rough and wet surfaces
The Full-Length Segmented Crash Pad provides a smooth heel-to-toe transition, according to a couple of reviews
It features a Ballistic Rock Shield that keeps foot well-protection while running on hard and rough terrains
The mesh upper of the Cascadia 11 keeps foot cool and dry
Cushioning is resilient, noted a handful of runners
cons: This shoe is slightly expensive for some runners
Some runners felt that this shoe is a bit heavy for them
Based on some reviews, the tongue feels off because it rubs the top of the foot

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable trail shoe....
customer_reviews.text: Would get five stars for comfort. These are some of the most popular hiking trail "slippers" with AT and Pacific Crest Trail Through-hikers. Because they are absolutely comfortable. I did 100 miles without even a break in before on a 7 day backpack around Mt Rainier in WA. Rugged terrain. No chafing no blisters, and ran into others with this shoe. The only reason it's not 5 stars is you should know they wear and tear easily, which means you'll be buying them more often than a less comfortable shoe. It's worth it to me. I love to hike, and this is my 3rd pair in 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Nonstop Bob

customer_reviews.title: it was amazing. This pair is wearing out a little faster ...
customer_reviews.text: Had an older gen of this shoe, it was amazing. This pair is wearing out a little faster than the last gen. The old pair also fit AMAZINGLY, and this one was a bit tight. I changed the lacing style (to horizontal) and it solved the narrow feeling of this pair. Only reason this got 4 starts is because the last pair blew... my... mind! so I might be comparing too much.
customer_reviews.author: Chase David

customer_reviews.title: but comfortable. These have a smaller toe box so I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for a couple of months now on intermediate trails. I previously wore the 10s. They were tight, but comfortable. These have a smaller toe box so I have been getting blisters. Those of you with slender feet will be fine, great shoe, but I must donate them to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ultra Runner Approved
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my husband for Christmas and he absolutely loves them. He was worried about the fit because he is used to running in older Brooks styles, but he says these "fit like a glove". He is an ultra runner and he is confident these will work for his next 100k race.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent shoe
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent shoe. Haven't done any trail runs in them yet but looking forward to it. The narrow toe box worries me a bit at first but seems to have stretched out a bit and I don't even notice it now. The heel is somewhat hard but I knew that going in. The sole has great grip and I'm guessing the tradeoff for that will be durability but I'm ok with that.
customer_reviews.author: Dru

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are for moderate pronation. I wear out one pair per year.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyB

customer_reviews.title: Decent shoes for me...
customer_reviews.text: Fits great, very comfortable, look good. I got them to replace my worn out PureCadences. They don't breathe nearly as well as the PC's and usually leave my sweaty feet damp by the end of a 12 hour shift (even with foot powder). The other con is they squeak VERY badly when wet on tile. Overall not bad though.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B.

customer_reviews.title: Good points, great price
customer_reviews.text: Two reasons for not giving it a 5-star; lots of dirt enters the shoe around the toes and wish the toe box was a bit wider. Good points, great price, speedy delivery, and great stability for trail running (I run areas with sand and tree roots)
customer_reviews.author: Dennis W. Higham

customer_reviews.title: I ordered two pairs
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to running shoe super comfortable doesn't need to be broken in and perfect for street and trail. The Cascadia 11 are classics.
customer_reviews.author: Dominik Espeleta

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. On my third pair! Only shoes I can find that prevent my shin splints, so I'm going to keep on buying them until they stop making them!
customer_reviews.author: Michael C

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are stylish but they run small. My ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are stylish but they run small. My toes are squeezed in. Also after a few uses the top strap that holds the shoelace in place tore causing less support on the ankle/ or top of the foot. I called Brooks customer support to file a claim and see if they will replace the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Nilda Cancino

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, too narrow :(
customer_reviews.text: I like the Brooks brand and have Brooks Ghost running shoes that are also a size 11. These were much narrower and very tight to the point that I was unable to wear them at all. Quality control regarding size is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: the best shoe I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: They are slightly thinner than I would like, I however find myself between sizes in most things. Like I wear size 31 jeans, impossible to find. The wide Shoes are too wide though...such is life. All garments mold to your body, shoes included, so give it time. width aside, they are still perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have used these trail running shoes for years. ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these trail running shoes for years. I replace every 6 months to maintain my "spring chicken" stride. No pain, no gain is not my mantra.
customer_reviews.author: E. R. Morris

customer_reviews.title: good for hiking.
customer_reviews.text: i always run in cascadia and bought these for my boyfriend for hiking. he loves them. and the color is rad.
customer_reviews.author: mad

customer_reviews.title: Brooks Cascadia  11 Men
customer_reviews.text: delivery was great, well packed , amazing shoe fits like glove ! I ordered half size up, because they're a little tigh in the front part !
customer_reviews.author: Julian Genis MD

customer_reviews.title: Very supportive
customer_reviews.text: These shoes give excellent support for trail running and hiking. I usually purchase the women's version of these, but I liked the blue/army green color of these. I highly recommend these trail shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: The shoe lace holder comes out of the side and can not be fixed easily. Making it so I cannot tie the shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes broke after approximately the 10th time wearing them. The shoe lace holder comes out of the side and can not be fixed easily. Making it so I cannot tie the shoe. I would not recommend buying!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just shy of excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe, except for the fact that the little yellow loops which hold the laces in the upper part of the shoe broke almost instantly. Other than that, though, they are excellent trail runners - great traction, comfortable fit once broken in a little, and the great arch support that I buy Brooks for.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Steele

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: The Brooks Cascadia fits uni-formally across the line good for a narrower heel and slightly pro-nated stride. I fell in love with the Cascadia 8 and know when my Cascadias wear out I can grab the same size and get a consistently comfortable fit from the newest version. If you like a firmer shoe (Nike tend to be way too "squishy" and I tend to roll my ankles in them) great surface feedback and the stone protector does a great job of protecting my arches.
customer_reviews.author: HandlebarLecturd

customer_reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Cascadia for 20 years. I have a bad back & these are the most help.
customer_reviews.author: David D. Brann

customer_reviews.title: They are great on the trail and the perfect fit for my ...
customer_reviews.text: I run a lot of miles in these shoes. They are great on the trail and the perfect fit for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: WS14

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: My husband buys this same shoe over and over and over. It's all he will wear!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: The trail shoes are just as good.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a brooks guy. I run in Brooks on the road. The trail shoes are just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I live in Lake Tahoe, They soul did not even last a half a season.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Fit great and love the
customer_reviews.text: Saved $$ buying online! Fit great and love the colors
customer_reviews.author: JoeyPRN

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: After the initial break-in, they're super comfortable and dry decently fast.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes. Good for trails
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes. Good for trails, walking, and jogging. They have good support as expected from Brooks. They help prevent cramping and pain on the bottom of my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great trail running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've used Cascadia for several years. Great trail shoes. Tough enough to shield your feet from sharp rocks underneath. Has a plush feel that I like. Durable and they go the distance.
customer_reviews.author: L. C. Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Another satisfied Brooks owner.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Fit is similar to other Brooks shoes. Great comfort and snug fit, without being overly tight. I owned the first three Cascadias and have always been a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like brooks cascadia they are really good for trail running and they have very good support.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit, very comfortable. A bit heavy, but expected for a trail shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have had previous models and find these to be very durable.
customer_reviews.author: rasterdogs

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe, but I find it runs about a half size bigger than other brooks shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. I get the next year's model every year.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Writer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A perfect medium duty trail shoe get both this and the water proof pair for your most entertaining runs.
customer_reviews.author: benjamin sebald

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product as advertised, fast shipping...would buy from the seller again, A1!!!
customer_reviews.author: Delvecchio N. Moses

customer_reviews.title: Love how they fit
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 8.5, but the size 8 Cascadia 11's fit me perfectly. Love how they fit.
customer_reviews.author: Ed B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great trail runners, true to size and perfect for a wide forefoot .
customer_reviews.author: joe m

customer_reviews.title: ... and he says these are one of the most comfortable pair of running shoes he's put on his feet
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for husband and he says these are one of the most comfortable pair of running shoes he's put on his feet!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shoe too narrow for my regular size foot
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a regular size 10 shoe. I ordered a size 11 shoe and the length was a little long.I could have got away with a 10.5.But the shoe was way too narrow for my foot.I had to return them.Also this shoe seems to not have very much padding in the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stick with these
customer_reviews.text: Stick with these shoes. No blisters for trail hiking. These are perfect. They may last 400 miles rather that 600 miles for other brands but the comfort and lack of blisters make up for it 1000%.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe for off pavement
customer_reviews.text: The medium is narrow. I wear a B so it is perfect. Sole is harder than street shoes as it should be. I like everything about this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Robin O.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't meet expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I expected more out of it as a running shoe. I used the shoe dog website, and it came up with this shoe. I've put in about 45 miles to date, and ....meh.
customer_reviews.author: ddi_123

customer_reviews.title: I love the way they fit
customer_reviews.text: The sole has started to pull apart and I have not worn them but maybe a total of a week. But I don't want to send them back and wait on another pair. I love the way they fit though
customer_reviews.author: TEFR

product_meta.title: Brooks Men's Cascadia 11 Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description:
Description 
The 4-point joint system acts as a custom suspension system, allowing you to control your foot on difficult ground. 
Mesh top, improves moisture management and helps keep feet cool and dry. 
Anti-rocas plate in the preview to protect the feet of soil hazards. 
DNA BioMoGo insoles offer long lasting infectious cushioning allowing for soft transitions. 
The sole is designed to improve traction on wet surfaces
feature_bullets: As well as an off-road for the feet, the Cascadia 11 offers balanced and cushioned pressure when you go out of the road.
